translated: Record of the Three Treasures through the Ages, Volume 14, Catalog of Small Vehicle Scriptures to be Included in the Canon
Submitted by the Imperial Secretary, Censor-in-Chief Fei Changfang, in the 17th year of the Kaihuang era
The Catalog of Small Vehicle Scriptures. The Small Vehicle Canon. Teaching and discussing the Buddha, he was born in the royal palace.
In the cradle, he was held and nursed.
Riding a sheep cart, he went to school.
Trying skills and techniques, he got married.
At nineteen, he left home and at thirty, he attained enlightenment.
For forty-nine years, he lived in the world and expounded the Dharma.
At the age of seventy-nine,
he lay down on his right side between the twin trees and entered parinirvÄá¹‡a.
If we discuss the Dharma specifically, it is the sÅ«tras.
Either stopping at nine sections,
or eleven sections.
The four Ä€gamas, miscellaneous Ä€gamas, and Abhidharma.
Discussing people, it is called the four fruits and four approaches of the Å›rÄvakas and pratyekabuddhas, the five directions and seven benefits.
Shaving the beard and hair, abandoning the secular and leaving home.
Limited to gods and humans, not including other destinies.
The afflictions are the five hindrances, ten entanglements, and ninety-eight latent afflictions.
The practices are the four noble truths and twelve links of dependent origination.
Restraining the seven branches and guarding the three karmas.
The precepts to be received and restrained are the three refuges, ten precepts, two hundred and fifty precepts, and five hundred precepts.
Only lasting for one lifetime, not extending to the next life.
Self-discipline of body and speech, not involving benefiting others.
The shallowness and depth of entering the water of principle.
Compared to the floating of rabbits and horses.
Playing in the streets and alleys.
Driving a humble cart pulled by sheep or deer.
The little moisture and nourishment.
Like the roots and leaves of small and medium-sized trees.
Resting and breathing to relieve fatigue, stopping at a provisional city that is not real.
All such texts are of the Lesser Vehicle.
Based on the four Ä€gamas, JÄtakas, UdÄnavarga, AvadÄna, and various sÅ«tras.
Either ten, five, one, or half a page.
Beginning with Thus have I heard and ending with I respectfully practice.
All these branches and divisions form ten thousand scrolls.
The worldly sentiments follow the end and compete in scattering and copying.
Not only does it harm the merit, but it greatly deviates from the original source.
But the various records and notes.
Those that flow out and give rise to other groups.
Like Avalokitesvara appearing in the Wonderful Dharma Flower.
The good goose king giving birth to the Right Dharma Thought.
Now they are not listed.
Only the four part vinaya, bhiká¹£u and bhiká¹£uá¹‡Ä« precepts, essentials of deportment, karman, and miscellaneous dharmas.
Since people of the world all study them, they are listed in full.
Those that are practitioners separated from the sÅ«tras.
Since the main text is already complete, there is no need to repeat it.
The benefits are minimal, and the troublesome parts are extensive.
Roughly calculating the savings.
One thousand two hundred sÅ«tras are reduced by ten thousand pages.
The current compilation includes the main text and separate scrolls.
Examining those that are not flowing out.
There are a total of five hundred twenty-five parts.
A total of one thousand seven hundred twelve scrolls.
Collected as the correct catalog for entering the canon of the Lesser Vehicle.
Fang's shallow views and narrow searches have left out much.
I hope to transmit the bright torch of the Dharma to the wise.
I hope you will all remove the ashes and add oil.ğŸ”½Here is the corrected and aligned text:
